decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to aggressively play and attack with creatures from the Gruul faction, utilizing cards such as Zhur-Taa Goblin, Gruul Spellbreaker, and Robber of the Rich. The deck focuses on dealing damage quickly and efficiently through a combination of creatures and spells like Domri's Ambush and Shock. Additionally, the inclusion of Domri, Anarch of Bolas and Questing Beast provides additional support and power to the aggressive strategy. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast-paced and relentless assault.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly play disruptive spells like Thought Erasure and Drown in the Loch to control the opponent's resources, while also using aggressive creatures like Thief of Sanity and Murderous Rider to apply pressure. Narset, Parter of Veils and Into the Story help with card advantage, while Enter the God-Eternals and Lochmere Serpent provide a powerful finisher. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining a strong board presence to quickly close out the game.

This deck focuses on aggressively attacking the opponent with low-cost creatures and utilizing their abilities to disrupt the opponent's strategy and gain card advantage. With cards like Ayara, First of Locthwain and Midnight Reaper providing card draw and life drain effects, along with Rankle, Master of Pranks causing chaos for the opponent, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The inclusion of Priest of Forgotten Gods adds additional disruption and resource management capabilities. Additionally, Castle Locthwain provides extra card draw in the late game to maintain momentum.

The focus of this deck is to quickly deploy aggressive creatures, backed up by countermagic, to pressure opponents and take control of the game. By utilizing efficient creatures like Brazen Borrower, Nightpack Ambusher, and Brineborn Cutthroat, along with spells like Sinister Sabotage and Quench, the deck aims to disrupt opponents' plans while maintaining a proactive game plan. The inclusion of cards like Once Upon a Time and Temple of Mystery ensure consistent mana development and card advantage, allowing the deck to maintain its tempo and apply continuous pressure on opponents.

The main idea of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient, aggressive creatures and disruptive cards. By using cards like Knight of the Ebon Legion and Rankle, Master of Pranks, the deck aims to apply early pressure and control the opponent's resources. The inclusion of cards like Burglar Rat and Yarok's Fenlurker disrupt the opponent's hand, while cards like Dreadhorde Invasion and Ayara, First of Locthwain provide additional sources of damage. The deck is designed to be fast-paced and relentless, aiming to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive green creatures and powerful planeswalkers. By ramping up mana with Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Paradise Druid, the deck aims to play large threats like Questing Beast and Voracious Hydra early on to deal damage quickly. Cards like Barkhide Troll and Thrashing Brontodon provide protection and removal, while The Great Henge boosts the deck's power and card advantage. Vivien, Arkbow Ranger and Veil of Summer offer additional support and protection to keep the pressure on the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful planeswalkers. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Duress and Legion's End, while deploying threats like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Vraska, Golgari Queen to generate value and maintain board control. The inclusion of versatile creatures like Questing Beast and Murderous Rider, as well as mana dorks like Gilded Goose, helps to ensure a smooth curve while providing additional threats and resources to outlast the opponent.

The main focus of this Simic Aggro deck is to control the board with counterspells and tempo plays while building a strong board presence with creatures like Brineborn Cutthroat and Nightpack Ambusher. By quickly developing a board and disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Sinister Sabotage and Brazen Borrower, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and efficient threats. This deck combines aggression and control elements to create a versatile and powerful strategy in Standard 1 vs 1 matches.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent quickly with aggressive creatures like Questing Beast and Rotting Regisaur. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Liliana, Dreadhorde General and Nissa, Who Shakes the World to generate value and control the board. Removal spells like Assassin's Trophy and Murderous Rider help clear the way for your creatures to attack. The deck's mana base is designed to support a mix of green and black spells, with cards like Once Upon a Time and Fabled Passage helping to ensure consistent mana production.

The key concept of this Orzhov Aggro deck is to quickly build a board presence with efficient creatures like Knight of the Ebon Legion and Worthy Knight, while also gaining value from cards like Midnight Reaper and Sorin, Vengeful Bloodlord. The deck aims to pressure the opponent early with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells like Legion's End, while also generating additional threats with cards like Corpse Knight and Cavalier of Night. The deck also utilizes powerful anthems like The Circle of Loyalty and Icon of Ancestry to further boost the strength of its creatures.

The deck focuses on mounting a fast and aggressive offense by utilizing efficient and evasive creatures like Brineborn Cutthroat and Nightpack Ambusher. It also emphasizes disruption and card advantage through counterspells like Quench and Sinister Sabotage, as well as card draw spells like Opt and Spectral Sailor. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent while maintaining control of the game with powerful threats such as Shifting Ceratops and Nissa, Who Shakes the World.

The main focus of this Simic Control deck is to establish strong board presence and mana ramp early on with cards like Gilded Goose and Paradise Druid, leading into powerful late-game threats such as Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Hydroid Krasis. The deck aims to control the game through cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Mass Manipulation, while also benefiting from card advantage and ramp with The Great Henge and Once Upon a Time. The deck utilizes a mix of creature and non-creature spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan and assert dominance over the battlefield.

The focus of this deck is to establish control through a combination of ramp and removal spells. By utilizing cards like Trail of Crumbs and Golden Egg for card advantage, along with impactful creatures like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Hydroid Krasis, the deck aims to outvalue opponents while disrupting their game plan with cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Wicked Wolf. The deck also includes a strong late-game threat in Feasting Troll King, allowing for a versatile and adaptive playstyle that can handle a variety of matchups.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing gate cards and powerful late-game threats. By ramping with Circuitous Route and Growth Spiral, the deck aims to quickly play powerful cards like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Agent of Treachery. With powerful board wipes like Gates Ablaze and Time Wipe, along with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler to control the opponent's moves, the deck aims to stall the game until it can overwhelm the opponent with its strong late-game threats and ultimately win the game through card advantage and board control.

This UW Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through countering spells, removing threats, and manipulating card advantage. The deck utilizes powerful control elements such as Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to control the game tempo. Cards like Time Wipe and Prison Realm provide removal options, while Dovin's Veto helps to counter opposing spells. The deck also includes card draw with Opt and Midnight Clock, along with win conditions like God-Eternal Kefnet and The Magic Mirror. Mystic Sanctuary is used to recur key spells from the graveyard to maintain control of the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures like Risen Reef and Cavalier of Thorns to ramp up and generate value. It also includes disruptive elements like Thought Erasure and Assassin's Trophy to control the opponent's resources. Yarok, the Desecrated enhances the effects of enter-the-battlefield triggers, while Jace, Wielder of Mysteries provides an alternative win condition. The mana base is designed to support the deck's diverse color requirements and maximize the potential of Field of the Dead to flood the board with zombie tokens. It aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a long game.
